summary: Completed comprehensive frontend testing of LinkedIn thought leadership site. All 9 team members with populated dashboards working perfectly. Content restructured successfully based on research document.
passed_tests: Landing page loads and displays all 9 team members with titles and target roles
Clicking on team member navigates to their dashboard successfully
Hero section shows name, title, niche statement, and target role pills for each member
Weekly engagement checklist displays 7 items with checkboxes that persist across sessions
ICP section shows 'Your Ideal Audience' with roles, company size, industry, situation
Connect if they / Just engage if they sections display criteria lists correctly
Pain points section shows collapsible cards with numbered pain points
Expanding pain point shows quotes with attribution and post angles
Content templates section displays all 8 templates (Hot Take, Value Bomb, Question Post, Listicle, Myth Buster, Story Post, Observation, Signal Post)
Copy template buttons work and copy text to clipboard with success toast
'What [Role]s Are Actually Saying' section displays trending topics with sources
'What to Post About' topic calendar shows categories with expandable details
Pro Tips section shows superpower, unique voice, avoid, lean into, best times, engagement hack
Opening Messages section is REMOVED (confirmed not present)
Theme toggle works perfectly (dark/light mode)
Back navigation works from dashboard to landing page
All team member dashboards have populated data with pain points, quotes, ICP details, topic calendars, and pro tips
Cross-browser functionality tested across multiple team members
State persistence working for checklist items
Responsive design elements working properly
